sections.heading: judgment; revivor; time limitation
sections.text: If a judgment becomes dormant, it may be revived in the same manner as is prescribed for reviving actions before judgment;Provided,no judgment shall be revived unless action to revive the same be commenced within ten years after such judgment became dormant.SourceR

sections.heading: applicable to judgments rendered by justice of peace. Miller v. Curry, 17 Neb. 321, 22 N.W. 559 (1885).
sections.text: applicable to judgments rendered by justice of peace. Miller v. Curry, 17 Neb. 321, 22 N.W. 559 (1885).
